question: How much money can Residents of India tremit upto?
explanation: Liberalised Remittance Scheme is applicable to all residents including the minors. If a minor has to apply for this scheme, Form A2 has to be filled and duly signed by the minor’s guardian. Under the Liberalised Remittance Scheme, residents of India are permitted to remit up to USD 250,000 for one financial year which is from April – March.
